intro: Porpax oblonga, commonly known as the oblong spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to oblong in shape. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. Porpax oblonga is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
